oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1939-11-11 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from November 11, 1939. Featuring David Stone (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Uncle Dave Macon and son Dorris Macon, Sam & Kirk McGee, Slim Smith, and Ford Rush. Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Uncle Dave Macon; Dorris Macon; Ford Rush; Sam & Kirk McGee; Slim Smith
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: [Unidentified song, test band] (excerpt) -- Wabash Cannonball (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) [continued from part 1] -- George D. Hay introduces Uncle Dave Macon and Dorris Macon -- Come Dearest The Daylight Is Gone (Uncle Dave Macon, Dorris Macon) -- George D. Hay introduces Ford Rush -- Old Grey Bonnet (Ford Rush, Smoky Mountain Boys) -- George D. Hay introduces Uncle Dave Macon -- I've Got A Mule To Ride (Uncle Dave Macon, Dorris Macon) -- George D. Hay introduces Sam & Kirk McGee and Slim Smith -- Corrine, Corrina (Sam & Kirk McGee, Slim Smith) -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys -- Red Wing (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- Prince Albert commercial (David Stone) -- Closing theme (Flop-Eared mule) -- Closing statement (George D. Hay) -- Closing statement (David Stone) -- Station announcements
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Stone, David P., 1901-1995; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Rush, Ford, 1895-; Macon, Uncle Dave, 1870-1952; Macon, Dorris; Sam & Kirk McGee (Musical group); McGee, Sam, 1894-1975; McGee, Kirk, 1899-1983; Smith, Slim
